page.description: Get the index of a Index from the name.
page.original:
SQL::TableInfo::IndexNumber() Syntax Index_Number as N = .IndexNumber( Name as C ) ArgumentDescription Index_NumberThe number of the index named. -1 if the index name is not in the column list. A SQL::TableInfo object. NameThe name of the index.
Description The IndexNumber() method gets the subscript of the requested index name in the Index array property. Example dim TableInfo as SQL::TableInfo dim IndexInfo as SQL::IndexInfo TableInfo.Name = "MyTable" IndexInfo.Name = "Primary_Key" IndexInfo.PrimaryKey = .t. ? TableInfo.AddIndex(IndexInfo) = 1 ? TableInfo.IndexNumber("Primary_Key") = 1
See Also SQL::TableInfo Object Limitations
